 28  # Conversion co-efficient to convert CMU skeletal dimensions to meters 
 29  # Taken from the CMU FAQ http://mocap.cs.cmu.edu/faqs.php 
 30  CMU_CONVERSION = (1.0/0.45)*2.54/100.0 
 31   
 32  # Co-efficient to convert values in m to cm 
 33  M_TO_CM_CONVERSION = 100 
 34  CM_TO_M_CONVERSION = 0.01

 36 -def loadBVHFile(filename, conversionFactor=1): 

 37      """ 
 38      Load sampled body model data from a BVH file. 
 39   
 40      @param filename: Name of file to load. 
 41      @param conversionFactor: Scale factor to apply to position values, e.g. 
 42          to convert meters to centimeters use conversionFactor=100. 
 43   
 44      @return: A L{SampledBodyModel} object. 
 45      """ 
 46      with open(filename,'r') as bvhFile: 
 47          loader = BVHLoader(bvhFile,conversionFactor) 
 48          loader._readHeader() 
 49          loader._readMotionData() 
 50      return loader.model 

 51

 53      ''' 
 54      Loader class for BVH files.

 56 -    def __init__(self, bvhFile, conversionFactor): 

 57          ''' 
 58          Construct a new BVH loader for the specified BVH file. 
 59          ''' 
 60          self.bvhFile = bvhFile 
 61          self.tokens = [] 
 62          self.line = 0 
 63          self.totalChannels = 0 
 64          self.startOfMotionData = None 
 65          self.conversionFactor = conversionFactor

 67 -    def _readHeader(self): 

 68          ''' 
 69          Read the header information from the BVH file. 
 70          ''' 
 71          assert self.bvhFile.tell() == 0, \ 
 72              'Must be at the start of file to read header' 
 73          self._checkToken("HIERARCHY") 
 74          self._checkToken("ROOT") 
 75          self.model = SampledBodyModel() 
 76          self.model.channels = [] 
 77          self.jointStack = [] 
 78          self.jointStack.append(self.model) 
 79          self._readJoint() 
 80          del self.jointStack 
 81   
 82          self._checkToken("MOTION") 
 83          self._checkToken("Frames:") 
 84          self.frameCount = self._intToken() 
 85          self._checkToken("Frame") 
 86          self._checkToken("Time:") 
 87          self.framePeriod = self._floatToken() 

 88   

 89 -    def _readMotionData(self): 

 90          ''' 
 91          Read the motion data from the BVH file. 
 92          ''' 
 93          # update joint tree with new data. 
 94          frame = 0 
 95          lastRotation = {} 
 96          for frame in range(self.frameCount): 
 97              time = frame * self.framePeriod 
 98              channelData = self._readFrame() 
 99              for joint in self.model.joints: 
100                  for chan in joint.channels: 
101                      chanData = channelData.pop(0) 
102                      if chan == "Xposition": 
103                          xPos = chanData 
104                      elif chan == "Yposition": 
105                          yPos = chanData 
106                      elif chan == "Zposition": 
107                          zPos = chanData 
108                      elif chan == "Xrotation": 
109                          xRot = chanData 
110                      elif chan == "Yrotation": 
111                          yRot = chanData 
112                      elif chan == "Zrotation": 
113                          zRot = chanData 
114                      else: 
115                          raise RuntimeError('Unknown channel: '+chan) 
116   
117                  if not joint.hasParent: 
118                      try: 
119                          p = np.array([[xPos,yPos,zPos]]).T * \ 
120                                  self.conversionFactor 
121                          p = convertCGtoNED(p) 
122                          del xPos, yPos, zPos 
123                          joint.positionKeyFrames.add(time, p) 
124                      except UnboundLocalError: 
125                          raise SyntaxError("No position data for root joint") 
126   
127                  try: 
128                      if joint.hasChildren: 
129                          q = Quaternion.fromEuler((zRot,xRot,yRot), order='zxy') 
130                          q = convertCGtoNED(q) 
131                          del xRot, yRot, zRot 
132                          # Rotation in BVH is relative to parent joint so 
133                          # combine the rotations 
134                          if joint.hasParent: 
135                              q = lastRotation[joint.parent] * q 
136                          joint.rotationKeyFrames.add(time, q) 
137                          lastRotation[joint] = q 
138                  except UnboundLocalError: 
139                      raise SyntaxError("No rotation data for a joint that " 
140                              "is not an end effector") 

141   

142 -    def _readFrame(self): 

143          ''' 
144          Read a frame of data from the BVH file. 
145   
146          @return: The channel data as a list of floats. 
147          ''' 
148          chanData = self._readline().split() 
149          if len(chanData) != self.totalChannels: 
150              raise SyntaxError, "Syntax error at line %d: Number of entries \ 
151  does not match the number of channels. (Found %d of %d)" %( 
152                  self.line,len(chanData),self.totalChannels) 
153          return map(float,chanData) 

154   

155 -    def _readJoint(self): 

156          # use jointStack[-1] to peek at the top of the jointStack 
157          currentJoint = self.jointStack[-1] 
158          name = self._token() 
159          # name will be 'Site' for End Site joints. 
160          if name == 'Site': 
161              name = currentJoint.parent.name+"_end" 
162          currentJoint.name = name 
163   
164          self._checkToken("{") 
165          while True: 
166              token = self._token() 
167              if token == "OFFSET": 
168                  x = self._floatToken() 
169                  y = self._floatToken() 
170                  z = self._floatToken() 
171                  currentJoint.positionOffset = \ 
172                          convertCGtoNED(np.array([[x,y,z]]).T*self.conversionFactor) 
173              elif token == "CHANNELS": 
174                  n = self._intToken() 
175                  channels = [] 
176                  for i in range(n): 
177                      token = self._token() 
178                      if token not in ["Xposition","Yposition","Zposition",\ 
179                                       "Xrotation","Yrotation","Zrotation"]: 
180                          raise SyntaxError, "Syntax error in line %d: Invalid \ 
181  channel name '%s'" %(self.line,token) 
182                      else: 
183                          channels.append(token) 
184                  self.totalChannels += n 
185                  currentJoint.channels = channels 
186              elif token in ("JOINT", "End"): 
187                  if token == "JOINT": 
188                      joint = SampledJoint(currentJoint) 
189                  else: 
190                      joint = PointTrajectory(currentJoint) 
191                  joint.channels = [] 
192                  self.jointStack.append(joint) 
193                  self._readJoint() 
194              elif token == "}": 
195                  self.jointStack.pop() 
196                  break 
197              else: 
198                  raise SyntaxError,\ 
199                      "Syntax error in line %d: Unknown keyword '%s'" %( 
200                              self.line,token) 

201   

202 -    def _checkToken(self,expectedToken): 

203          ''' 
204          Try to read an expected token from the input queue. 
205   
206          @raise SyntaxError: if the expected token is not found. 
207          ''' 
208          token = self._token() 
209          if token != expectedToken: 
210              raise SyntaxError, "Syntax error in line %d: Expected %s \ 
211  but found %s" %(self.line,expectedToken,token) 

212   

213 -    def _intToken(self): 

214         ''' 
215         Read an integer value from the token queue. 
216         ''' 
217         token = self._token() 
218         try: 
219             return int(token) 
220         except ValueError: 
221             raise SyntaxError, 'Syntax error in line %d: Integer \ 
222  expected but found %s' %(self.line,token)

224 -    def _floatToken(self): 

225          ''' 
226          Read a float value from the token queue. 
227          ''' 
228          token = self._token() 
229          try: 
230              return float(token) 
231          except ValueError: 
232              raise SyntaxError, 'Syntax error in line %d: Float \ 
233  expected but found %s' %(self.line,token) 

234   

235 -    def _token(self): 

236          ''' 
237          Return the next token in the input file. 
238          ''' 
239          try: 
240              return self.tokens.pop(0) 
241          except IndexError: 
242              # There are no more tokens in the queue so read the next line 
243              l = self._readline() 
244              tokens = l.strip().split() 
245              for token in tokens: 
246                  self.tokens.append(token) 
247              # recurse to return the next token or read another line 
248              return self._token() 

249   

250 -    def _readline(self): 

251          ''' 
252          Read a line from the input file and add the tokens to the list of 
253          tokens to process. 
254          ''' 
255          l = self.bvhFile.readline() 
256          self.line+=1 
257          if l != "": 
258              return l 
259          else: 
260              raise StopIteration

262 -def saveBVHFile(model, filename, samplePeriod, conversionFactor = 1): 

263      """ 
264      Save a body model data to a BVH file. 
265   
266      @param model: Body model to save. 
267      @param filename: Name of file to write to. 
268      @param samplePeriod: The time between frames in the BVH output. 
269      @param conversionFactor: Scale factor to apply to position values, e.g. 
270          to convert meters to centimeters use conversionFactor=100. 
271      """ 
272      with open(filename,'w') as bvhFile: 
273          exporter = BVHExporter(model,bvhFile, samplePeriod, conversionFactor) 
274          exporter.writeHeader() 
275          for frame in xrange(exporter.frames): 
276              exporter.writeFrame(model.startTime + frame * samplePeriod) 

277

284      @ivar samplePeriod: The time between frames in the BVH output 
285      @ivar conversionFactor: Scale factor to apply to position values, e.g. 
286          to convert meters to centimeters use conversionFactor=100. 
287      """ 
288   

289 -    def __init__(self, model, bvhFile, samplePeriod, conversionFactor): 

290          ''' 
291          Construct BVH exporter. 
292

295          @param samplePeriod: The time between frames in the BVH output. 
296          @param conversionFactor: Scale factor to apply to position values, e.g. 
297              to convert meters to centimeters use conversionFactor=100. 
298          ''' 
299          self.bvhFile = bvhFile 
300          self.model = model 
301          self.samplePeriod = samplePeriod

303   
304      @property 

305 -    def frames(self): 

306          """ The number of frames that will be exported. """ 
307          return int((self.model.endTime - self.model.startTime) // 
308                  self.samplePeriod) 

309   

310 -    def writeHeader(self): 

311          """ 
312          Write the header of the BVH file. 
313          """ 
314          self.bvhFile.write('HIERARCHY\n') 
315          pad = "  " 
316          def post(j): 
317              self.bvhFile.write("%s}\n" %(pad*j.depth)) 

318          for p in self.model.preorderTraversal(postFunc=post): 
319              d = p.depth 
320              if not p.hasParent: 
321                  self.bvhFile.write("%sROOT %s\n" %(pad*d, p.name)) 
322              elif p.isJoint: 
323                  self.bvhFile.write("%sJOINT %s\n" %(pad*d, p.name)) 
324              else: 
325                  self.bvhFile.write("%sEnd Site\n" %(pad*d)) 
326              self.bvhFile.write("%s{\n" %(pad*d)) 
327   
328              self.bvhFile.write("%sOFFSET" %(pad*(d+1))) 
329              for v in convertNEDtoCG(p.positionOffset): 
330                  self.bvhFile.write(" %.8f" % (v * self.conversionFactor)) 
331              self.bvhFile.write("\n") 
332   
333              if p.isJoint: 
334                  if not hasattr(p, "channels"): 
335                      if not p.hasParent: 
336                          p.channels = ["Xposition", "Yposition", "Zposition", 
337                              "Zrotation", "Xrotation", "Yrotation"] 
338                      else: 
339                          p.channels = ["Zrotation", "Xrotation", "Yrotation"] 
340   
341                  self.bvhFile.write("%sCHANNELS %d" %(pad*(d+1),len(p.channels))) 
342                  for chan in p.channels: 
343                      self.bvhFile.write(" %s" % chan) 
344                  self.bvhFile.write("\n") 
345   
346          self.bvhFile.write("MOTION\nFrames: %d\nFrame Time: %.8f\n" %( 
347              self.frames,self.samplePeriod)) 

348   

349 -    def writeFrame(self, t): 

350          for j in self.model.joints: 
351              if hasattr(j,'channels') and len(j.channels) > 0: 
352   
353                  if not j.hasParent: 
354                      pos = j.position(t) * self.conversionFactor 
355                      pos = convertNEDtoCG(pos) 
356   
357                  rot = j.rotation(t) 
358                  if j.hasParent: 
359                      # BVH rotations are relative to parent joint 
360                      # RigidBodyModel rotations are absolute 
361                      rot = j.parent.rotation(t).conjugate * rot 
362                  rot = convertNEDtoCG(rot) 
363                  rot = rot.toEuler(order='zxy') 
364   
365                  for chan in j.channels: 
366                      if chan == 'Xposition': 
367                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %pos[0]) 
368                      elif chan == 'Yposition': 
369                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %pos[1]) 
370                      elif chan == 'Zposition': 
371                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %pos[2]) 
372                      elif chan == 'Zrotation': 
373                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %rot[0]) 
374                      elif chan == 'Xrotation': 
375                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %rot[1]) 
376                      elif chan == 'Yrotation': 
377                          self.bvhFile.write("%f " %rot[2]) 
378          self.bvhFile.write("\n")
